item.description:
• Version 1.16.0 (Build 46):
    • Improves the SUDA Activities widget.
  • Version 1.15.0 (Build 45):
    • Improved the usability of the MC flyby simulations.
    • Added SUDA activities widget.
  • Version 1.14.0 (Build 44):
    • As default only Thrace and Thera Macula and Chaos North and South are selected as unique geologic regions. The regions default setup is Type A: 5%, Type B: 5%, and Type C: 90%.
    • Derives an estimator for the type abundance within a feature from the observed sequence of composition as described in Goode et al, 2023. The corresponding plots can be selected in the MC mode on the Flyby tab.
    • This version has been compiled without Swift optimizations, which are causing mystery crashes on OS versions earlier than Sequoia.
  • Version 1.12.0 (Build 43):
    • Composition types can now be assigned to geologic features and the background surface.
    • Ejecta impact rates can now be plotted as function of their composition types.
    • Fixes an issue where the wrong flyby panel number was shown in the sidebar.
    • Annotates compositional mapping plots.
    • Improves the distance scale labels.
  • Version 1.11.0 (Build 42):
    • App can now import TID simulation data.
    • Sidebar presents the absorbed dose during the activity.
    • Fixes a bug which causes the app to crash on computers after updating from rather old versions.
  • Version 1.10.1 (Build 41):
    • Fixes a bug which causes the app to crash after a fresh installation.
  • Version 1.10.0 (Build 40):
    • The kernels of the default tour(s) are not any longer bundled with the app, but will be installed when launching the app.
    • Added sub-baseline tour candidate S2V7.
    • Added fallback to a strict nadir tracking S/C attitude profile for flybys without CK coverage (there is no CK for S2S7 yet.).
    • Experimental: It is now possible to simultanously work with tours with different Spice setups.
    • Bug fixes.
  • Version 1.9.0 (Build 39):
    • Improves the setup of Spice kernels to load. You can now either load the kernels using meta kernel, or you can select individual kernels via a user interface.
    • Adds the ability to show the MC rates of ejecta emitted from features and from the background.
    • Bug fixes.
  • Version 1.8.0 (Build 37):
    • Improved geologic landforms editor. Landforms can be renamed.
    • Increased the maximum number of landforms tracked for ejecta emission to 10.
    • Flyby sidebar lists number of ejecta emitted from landform.
    • Bug fixes.
  • Version 1.7.1 (Build 36):
    • Reduced app size: The surface maps are not any longer bundled with the app but will be loaded from the server.
    • Code base is now compliant with xCode 16 and Swift 6.
  • Version 1.7.0 (Build 35):
    • Monte Carlo simulations of SUDA flybys.
    • Marks launch and detection sites.
    • Landforms can now be downselected.
  • Version 1.6.0 (Build 34):
    • Added Cruise pannel:
      • Added cruise CK to app bundle.
      • IDP model by Divine for estimating dust count.
      • Pointing models for IDPs, ISD, and Jovian nanograins.
    • Added splash screen (experimental).
    • Added roadmap.
    • Performance improvements.
  • Version 1.4.0 (Build 32):
    • Shows ground tracks.
    • Marks landforms on surface maps.
    • Added dialog for importing KML encoded landform definitions.
  • Version 1.2.1 (Build 30):
    • Can be run without any external Spice ressources. To this aim unselect "Spice data is loaded from user-defined directory". In this configuration the app uses the 21F31V6 tour kernels, which are bundled with the app.
    • Improved import of tour simulations.
    • Improved requirement verification.
    • Many bug fixes and improvements.
  • Version 1.1.0 (Build 28):
    • Migrated orbit, time line, ring survey, and nanograin viewers.
    • Analyses orbits, identifies ring and nanograins survey opportunities.
  • Version 1.0.1 (Build 26):
    • Identifies flybys on Jovian moons based on Europa Clipper kernels.
    • Analyses flybys, predicts impact rates, and identifies health and safety issues.
